title: Time-Domain Bound States in the Continuum
authors:
Oded Schiller, Yonatan Plotnik, Ohad Segal, Mark Lyubarov and
  Mordechai Segev
abstract:
We present the concept of time-domain bound states in continuum. We show that
a rapid judiciously-designed temporal modulation of the refractive index in a
spatially homogenous medium gives rise to a bound state in time embedded in a
continuum of wavenumbers. Mathematically, these bound states in the continuum
(BIC) are analytic solutions of the Maxwell equations in time and
one-dimensional space. Our results show the potential to extend known wave
phenomena in space to the temporal domain, providing new avenues for
light-matter interactions in time-varying media.
